item.title: Paris Attacks Plotted by Belgian Who Fought for ISIS, French Officials Say
item.description: Abdelhamid Abaaoud was already wanted for a terrorist plot that was foiled in January. The French president declared that “France is at war.”
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA, AURELIEN BREEDEN and KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:credit: Militant Website, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Abdelhamid Abaaoud, a 27-year-old Belgian man who has fought with the Islamic State in Syria.

item.title: After Paris Attacks, C.I.A. Director Rekindles Debate Over Surveillance
item.description: The director, John O. Brennan, criticized “hand-wringing” over spying by governments and said that restrictions on surveillance made it harder to find terrorists.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT SHANE
item.media:description: John O. Brennan, the director of the Central Intelligence Agency, speaking at the Center for Strategic and International Studies on Monday in Washington.

item.title: John Kerry Arrives in Paris to Show ‘Shared Resolve’ After Attacks
item.description: The secretary of state’s trip was not announced in advance because of security concerns, and he was scheduled to meet with President François Hollande on Tuesday.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

item.title: Paris Attacks Give Rise to Fakes and Misinformation
item.description: Whenever there is big news, like Friday’s terror attacks in France, altered images, bogus tweets and odd theories abound.
item.dc:creator: KATIE ROGERS
item.media:description: The lights of the Eiffel Tower were switched off on Saturday after several terror attacks the night before in Paris. Online rumors abounded over when and why the lights on the tower had been dimmed.

item.title: Obama Defends His Strategy on ISIS
item.description: The president said his strategy for defeating the Islamic State is working and that turning away Syrian refugees based on religion would be un-American.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and PETER BAKER

item.title: After Paris Attacks, Waiting for Shopping and Culture to Come Back to Life
item.description: In other cities hit by terrorist attacks, effects on commerce have been short-lived. Will the French capital — and the broader eurozone — be different?
item.dc:creator: DAVID JOLLY, JACK EWING and DOREEN CARVAJAL
item.media:description: Mounted police patrol the Christmas market on the Avenue des Champs-Élysées.

item.title: Israeli Soldiers Raid West Bank Refugee Camp, Prompting Deadly Clashes
item.description: Two Palestinians were killed and several others were wounded as residents said that up to 1,000 troops entered the camp between Jerusalem and Ramallah.
item.dc:creator: RAMI NAZZAL and ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: The Attacks in Paris Reveal the Strategic Limits of ISIS
item.description: Globalized terrorism is no more effective than conducting aerial bombings without forces on the ground.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: OLIVIER ROY
item.media:credit: Pierre Terdjman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Police patrol the Place de la République in Paris.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Standing With France, China Complains of Antiterror Double Standard
item.description: Along with revulsion, Chinese leaders and many citizens also voiced a more complex mix of expectations and emotions, rooted in rival views of the country’s own problems.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: The Oriental Pearl Tower in Shanghai was bathed in blue, white and red, the colors of the French flag, after the attacks in Paris.

item.title: Philippines Detaining Homeless Before APEC Summit, Rights Group Says
item.description: Human Rights Watch says the Philippines is rounding up homeless people to get them off the streets during this week’s Asia-Pacific economic forum.
item.dc:creator: FLOYD WHALEY

item.title: U.S. Warplanes Strike ISIS Oil Trucks in Syria
item.description: The assault is part of a broader operation to disrupt the ability of the Islamic State to generate revenue to support its military operations.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Obama and Putin Discuss ISIS and Syria in Informal Conversation
item.description: The two men, in Turkey for the Group of 20 summit meeting, talked for 35 minutes, though a Russian official said they disagreed on how to deal with with the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR

item.title: Paris Attacks: What We Know and Don’t Know
item.description: A briefing with the latest information.
item.dc:creator: VICTORIA SHANNON
item.media:description: A memorial outside the Carillon restaurant in Paris on Sunday, one of the sites of the attacks on Friday.

item.title: Nordic Countries, Overwhelmed by Migrants, Retreat From Generous Traditions
item.description: The abrupt change in the Nordic nations is one of the most striking consequences of the surge of asylum seekers in Europe this year.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: SUZANNE DALEY

item.title: Japan Economy Contracts 0.8%, Returning to Recession
item.description: The economic data was worse than economists expected, and put the country into its fifth recession since the financial crisis of 2008.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN SOBLE
item.media:description: Lately there is less demand for Japan’s construction machinery.

item.title: Political Memo: In Presidential Campaign, It’s Now Terrorism, Not Taxes
item.description: The assault on Paris has thrust national security to the heart of the presidential race, forcing candidates to scramble to address terrorism concerns.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN MARTIN
item.media:credit: Isaac Brekken for The New York Times
item.media:description: Ben Carson has voiced opposition to letting Syrian refugees into the United States.

item.title: ​Supporting France, Obama Loath to Add Troops to ISIS Fight
item.description: Even as the president searched for ways to step up the war against the terrorist group, White House officials again ruled out introducing substantial numbers of American ground troops.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and PETER BAKER
item.media:description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey and President Obama at the Group of 20 meeting in Antalya, Turkey, on Sunday.

item.title: 5 Yemeni Guantánamo Inmates Are Sent to United Arab Emirates
item.description: The lower-level detainees had been held for nearly 14 years but never charged with a crime, and their transfers reduce the population at the prison in Cuba to 107.
item.dc:creator: CHARLIE SAVAGE
item.media:description: The Guantánamo Bay prison in Cuba in 2010. The transfer of five inmates to the United Arab Emirates leaves the detainee population at the prison at 107.

item.title: France Strikes ISIS Targets in Syria in Retaliation for Attacks
item.description: The French Defense Ministry said a raid led by 12 French aircraft had destroyed two Islamic State targets in Raqqa, the group’s self-proclaimed capital.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN and ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Mourners outside La Belle Équipe, where at least a dozen people died.

item.title: France Strikes ISIS Targets in Syria in Retaliation for Attacks
item.description: The French Defense Ministry said a raid led by 12 French aircraft had destroyed two Islamic State targets in Raqqa, the group’s self-proclaimed capital.
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN and ANNE BARNARD
